content.webTitle: Cameraman tells how he escaped Iraq gunfight

fields.headline: Cameraman tells how he escaped Iraq gunfight
fields.bodyText: Cameraman Daniel Demoustier, the only member of the four-man crew to survive the Iraq war gunfight that killed ITN reporter Terry Lloyd in March 2003, yesterday told an inquest into Lloyd's death how they came under fire on the road to Basra. They had stopped in front of Iraqi troops. Sensing danger, they attempted to drive away. Two Iraqis pulled up alongside in a car, then firing began, but not from the car. He said he was shot and their car exploded. He tried to alert US tanks. "I stood up with my hands up but they started shooting again." The inquest continues.
